Package ser321.assign2.lindquis

Class MediaLibraryGui

java.lang.Object
java.awt.Component
java.awt.Container
java.awt.Window
java.awt.Frame
javax.swing.JFrame
ser321.assign2.lindquis.MediaLibraryGui
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, javax.accessibility.Accessible, javax.swing.RootPaneContainer, javax.swing.WindowConstants
Direct Known Subclasses:
MediaLibraryApp
public class MediaLibraryGui
extends javax.swing.JFrame
Copyright 2020 Tim Lindquist, Right to Use: Students in ASU Software Engineering course Ser321 are granted the right to use this and dependent classes in their compiled (bytecode) format only for the purposes of solving programming assignments in Ser321. Distribution is not permitted beyond the purposes of completing assignments in Ser321. This software uses software that is copyrighted by Oracle as documented elsewhere in these javadocs. The class ser321.assign2.lindquis.MediaControl has the following copyright Copyright (c) 2008, 2012 Oracle and/or its affiliates. All rights reserved. Use is subject to license terms. See javadocs for further information. The class ser321.assign2.lindquis.MediaLibraryGui is copyrighted by Dr Lindquist. Purpose: Window class for students in Ser321 to develop their music browser and player. This class uses the JavaFX framework for media playback, and creates playback controls using the class MediaLibraryGui which creates a window with a File, Album, and Track menus. The menus, menuitems, and action commands contained in the menus are exposed to the controller (super-class) through protected fields of MediaLibraryGui. The window is a split pane with scroll pane on each side. The left scroll pane has a tree should be used to display the media library structure -- Album titles with each Album having sub-nodes with titles representing the music track. The right pane has the JTextField's and JComboBox for viewing and entering Album and Track Information. The bottom of the right side displays music playback controls when a track is playing. The center of the right side contains two components: The left to display an image of the album (png), as loaded through a URL. The right side is to provide summary information about an album (tag:summary). MediaLibraryGui contains protected definitions for its members, which need to be accessed by the controller class. The protected fields can be accessed by an extending class (MediaLibraryApp) to gain access to the GUI components. Ser321 Principles of Distributed Software Systems see http://pooh.poly.asu.edu/Ser321
Version:
January 2020
Author:
Tim Lindquist (Tim.Linquist@asu.edu), Software Engineering, CIDSE, IAFSE, ASU Poly

      public javax.swing.JLabel displayPane

    • tree

      protected javax.swing.JTree tree
      tree is the javax.swing.JTree displayed in the left pane of the window.

    • menuNames

      protected java.lang.String[] menuNames
      String array of menu names The array's value is: {"File","Album","Track"}

    • fileMenuNames

      protected java.lang.String[] fileMenuNames
      Array of strings naming the menuitem names for File menu. The array's value is: {"Save","Restore","Tree Refresh","Exit"}.

    • fileActionNames

      protected java.lang.String[] fileActionNames
      Array of strings naming the action commands for File menu. The array's value is: {"Save","Restore","Tree Refresh","Exit"}.

    • albumMenuNames

      protected java.lang.String[] albumMenuNames
      Array of strings naming the menuitem names for the Album menu. The array's value is: {"Add","Remove","Play"}.

    • albumActionNames

      protected java.lang.String[] albumActionNames
      Array of strings naming the action commands for Album menu. The array's value is: {"AlbumAdd","AlbumRemove","AlbumPlay"}.

    • trackMenuNames

      protected java.lang.String[] trackMenuNames
      Array of strings naming the menuitem names for the Track menu. The array's value is: {"Add","Remove","Play"}.

    • trackActionNames

      protected java.lang.String[] trackActionNames
      Array of strings naming the action commands for Track menu. The array's value is: {"TrackAdd","TrackRemove","TrackPlay"}.

    • userMenuItems

      protected javax.swing.JMenuItem[][] userMenuItems
      The menu items. Each entry in the array is a javax.swing.JMenuItem. userMenuItems is an array of arrays. Each sub array contains the JMenuItem objects for the respective menus (File and Media). Note the order in this array matches the order in the menuNames arrays.

    • menuItemNames

      protected java.lang.String[][] menuItemNames
      The menu item names. menuItemNames is an array of arrays. Note the order in this array matches the order in menu names array.

    • menuActionNames

      protected java.lang.String[][] menuActionNames
      The menu item Action names. menuActionNames is an array of arrays. Note the order in this array matches the order in menu names array.

    • summaryJTA

      protected javax.swing.JTextArea summaryJTA
      The javax.swing.JTextArea for entering and displaying an album's summary

    • trackJTF

      protected javax.swing.JTextField trackJTF
      The javax.swing.JTextField for entering and displaying the title of the track

    • albumJTF

      protected javax.swing.JTextField albumJTF
      The javax.swing.JTextField for entering and displaying the Album name.

    • authorJTF

      protected javax.swing.JTextField authorJTF
      The javax.swing.JTextField for entering and displaying the music artist's name (group name).

    • rankJTF

      protected javax.swing.JTextField rankJTF
      The javax.swing.JTextField for entering and displaying a track's rank in the album.

    • timeJTF

      protected javax.swing.JTextField timeJTF
      The javax.swing.JTextField for displaying the album or track playing time. Which is displayed depends on the type of node currently selected in the JTree tree.

    • albumSearchJTF

      protected javax.swing.JTextField albumSearchJTF
      The javax.swing.JTextField for user to enter album name to be searched. This field appears in the left panel above the Tree and is labelled Album.

    • artistSearchJTF

      protected javax.swing.JTextField artistSearchJTF
      The javax.swing.JTextField for user to enter artist name to be searched. This field appears in the left panel above the Tree and is labelled Artist.

    • genreJCB

      protected javax.swing.JComboBox<java.lang.String> genreJCB
      The javax.swing.JComboBox for displaying genre of the album, as reported by the web service in the tag field. There may be more than one genre and the combo box need not be editable by the user. Default is the single genre: unknown

    • fileNameJTF

      protected javax.swing.JTextField fileNameJTF
      The javax.swing.JTextField for entering the music mp3 file name, such as ByeByeLove.mp3

    • searchJButt

      protected javax.swing.JButton searchJButt
      the javax.swing.JButton labelled Search. When clicked, the app should send a request to LastFM's api requesting json information about the Album and Artist. The button appears in the left panel of the GUI, above the Tree. When the search is successful, (you can assume it is), the app parses the json returned building an Album and corresponding track objects. The tree then is re-generated to display only the Album resulting from the search.

  • Constructor Details

    • MediaLibraryGui

      public MediaLibraryGui​(java.lang.String base)
      The constructor for the MediaLibraryGui. This method creates all of the components of the User Interface and causes it to appear on the screen. It provides the application's view.
      Parameters:
      base - the string indicating the author of the Music Browser.

  • Method Details

    • setAlbumImage

      public void setAlbumImage​(java.lang.String urlString)
      Set the display pane to a png image. This method is used to display a png in the GUI. Png is loaded from a url. If the method is unable to load and display the image, it prints a message to the console.
      Parameters:
      urlString - The string url naming the png file to be loaded and displayed. For example: "https://lastfm.freetls.fastly.net/i/u/300x300/3b54885952161aaea4ce2965b2db1638.png"

    • buildInitialTree

      protected void buildInitialTree​(javax.swing.tree.DefaultMutableTreeNode root, java.lang.String base)
      Create and initialize nodes in the JTree of the left pane. buildInitialTree is called by MediaLibraryGui to initialize the JTree. Classes that extend MediaLibraryGui should override this method to provide initialization actions specific to the extended class. The default functionality is to set base as the label of root.
      Parameters:
      root - Is the root node of the tree to be initialized.
      base - Is the label of the root node of the tree.

    • playMedia

      protected void playMedia​(java.lang.String path, java.lang.String title)
      protected method to play a media file. The playMedia method causes a new thread to be created to play the media. Playing a media file checks to see whether an existing playback is already active and if so, it disposes of the current playing media. The thread is an object of an internal class.
      Parameters:
      path - Is the string url file path to the media file: for example:

      file:///home/lindquis/Ser321/Assign6/Music/comemonday.mp3

      Do not use a string literal for the path. Build the url as is shown in the Sample by obtaining the value of the System property user.dir. That way your solution will work no matter where on your filesystem you place your solution directory. This is necessary for grading to get full credit.

      title - Is the string title of the media file designated by path.
